marketNews.title: US Postpones Tariffs for Canada & Mexico; China Retaliates with Tariffs on US
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, announced a postponement of the implementation of a 25% import tariff for Canada and Mexico for 30 days while negotiations continue to increase law enforcement efforts at the borders of these countries with the US. Meanwhile, an additional 10% import tariff for China will apply as scheduled, effective Tuesday (4/2) local time. This agreement came just a few days after Trump last weekend announced he would impose a 25% import tariff for Canada and Mexico and an additional 10% import tariff on top of existing tariffs for China effective Tuesday (4/2). Trump previously stated that the imposition of these tariffs was in response to the flow of narcotics and immigrants entering the US from these countries. Following the effectivity of tariffs from the US, China also announced on Tuesday (4/2) afternoon that it would impose additional import tariffs on several commodities from the US effective February 10, 2025, consisting of: Additional tariff of 15% for coal and liquefied natural gas (LNG); Additional tariff of 10% for crude oil, agricultural machinery, large engine capacity cars, and pick-up trucks. Besides imposing additional tariffs, China also took several other actions, such as an investigation into alleged anti-monopoly violations by Google, imposing export restrictions on tungsten and other rare earth elements in technology products, and limiting the operations of several US companies such as Illumina and PVH Corp. Following these developments, the US dollar index (DXY) and US stock futures moved volatilesly on Tuesday (4/2). DXY strengthened up to above 109 but is now at the level of 108.5. Meanwhile, S&P 500 futures fell -0.16% after having strengthened +0.78% in early trading. Commodity prices that will be subject to additional tariffs by China also decreased, with WTI oil prices in the futures market weakening -2.06% to the level of 71.7 US dollars per barrel and natural gas prices falling -3.98% to the level of 3.22 US dollars per MMBtu.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Developments in the trade war continue to be the main issue that investors need to watch. Before China announced retaliatory tariffs, White House Press Secretary, Karoline Leavitt, said that Trump would meet with Chinese President, Xi Jinping, in the next few days. Additionally, how the Chinese government will peg the exchange rate range against the US dollar after the long holiday on Wednesday (5/2) will also be a focus for investors as it can provide a clue regarding China's stance on tariffs from the US. *This article was previously released on Tuesday (4/2) morning in Stockbit Commentary.

marketNews.title: Grab Reportedly Plans to Acquire GOTO with a Valuation of US$7 Billion
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB) is considering acquiring GoTo Gojek Tokopedia with a valuation of more than 7 billion US dollars. Bloomberg sources stated that one scenario being discussed is the purchase of all GOTO shares worth more than 100 rupiah per share, about +15% higher than its share price on Tuesday (4/2) at the level of 87 rupiah per share. A GOTO spokesperson declined to comment on this issue, while the Grab representative has not provided a comment. The Bloomberg report emerged after DealStreetAsia reported that GOTO and Grab are accelerating merger talks and aiming for a deal to be reached in 2025. Previously, the two ride-hailing companies had held merger talks for several years, aimed at reducing costs and competitive pressure. However, the previous merger plan had a number of challenges, such as disagreements between the parties and potential obstacles from anti-monopoly regulations. Bloomberg sources also said that current merger talks might not result in any transaction.

marketNews.title: Darma Henwa Reportedly Submits Share Purchase Offer for J Resources Asia Pasifik (PSAB)
marketNews.content: Bloomberg Technoz reported that Darma Henwa ($DEWA) plans to acquire 92.5% of J Resources Asia Pasifik shares from its controller, Jimmy Budiarto, with an offer price of 400 rupiah per share. This price is +41% higher than PSAB's share price at the market close on Tuesday (4/2) at the level of 284 rupiah per share. DEWA management told Bloomberg Technoz that the company was unaware of this issue. Previously, Bloomberg Technoz in early August 2024 reported that Delta Dunia Makmur ($DOID) and the Salim group - through Amman Mineral Internasional ($AMMN) - respectively planned to buy 92.5% of PSAB shares from Jimmy Budiarto in 1Q25. Bloomberg Technoz reported that DOID bid for PSAB shares at a price of 300 rupiah per share, while the Salim group reportedly bid at a price of 350 rupiah per share.

marketNews.title: Bukit Asam Recorded Coal Sales Volume of 42.9 Million Tons throughout 2024
marketNews.content: Bukit Asam recorded a coal sales volume of 42.9 million tons during 2024 (+16% YoY), slightly below the 2024 guidance of 43.1 million tons despite marking PTBA's all-time highest sales volume. Sales consisted of exports of 20.3 million tons (+30.5% YoY) and domestic sales of 22.6 million tons (+5.6% YoY). Quarterly, PTBA recorded a coal sales volume of 11.6 million tons in 4Q24 (+3.4% QoQ, +16.3% YoY). PTBA itself targets coal production throughout 2025 to reach 50 million tons (+15.5% YoY), with a target coal sales volume of 50.1 million tons (+16.8% YoY).

marketNews.title: Central Omega Resources Recorded Nickel Ore Production Volume of 1.2 Million WMT in 4Q24
marketNews.content: Central Omega Resources recorded a nickel ore production volume of 1.2 million wmt in 4Q24 (+112% YoY, +17% QoQ). This result brought the total nickel ore production volume in 2024 to 3 million wmt (+130% YoY), equivalent to 134% of the 2024 target of 2.2 million wmt. The company also recorded a nickel ore sales volume of 852,903 wmt in 4Q24 (+55% YoY, -18% QoQ), so the total nickel ore sales volume in 2024 grew +105% YoY to 2.6 million wmt and equivalent to 118% of the 2024 target of 2.2 million wmt. DKFT itself as of July 2024 obtained a RKAB production permit of 2.95 million wmt per year for 2025 and 2026.

marketNews.title: Puradelta Lestari Recorded Marketing Sales of IDR 1.87 Trillion throughout 2024
marketNews.content: Puradelta Lestari recorded marketing sales of 1.87 trillion rupiah during 2024, stable compared to 2023 realization and exceeding (104%) the 2024 target of 1.81 trillion rupiah. The industrial segment contributed ~96.1% of total marketing sales during 2024 through the sale of industrial land of 59 hectares, with more than 60% of industrial segment marketing sales coming from data centers. Meanwhile, the residential segment contribution reached 2.3% and the commercial segment reached 1.6%.

marketNews.title: Medikaloka Hermina CEO Acquired HEAL Shares
marketNews.content: The controller and President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Hasmoro, purchased 787,000 HEAL shares at an average price of 1,434 rupiah per share on January 30, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~1.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Hasmoro's ownership in HEAL increased from ~4.720% to 4.725%.

marketNews.title: Tugu Pratama Indonesia Insurance Will Divest Overseas Property Assets Worth IDR 1 Trillion
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that Asuransi Tugu Pratama Indonesia will sell property assets abroad with a divestment value reaching 1 trillion rupiah. TUGU's President Director, Tatang Nurhidayat, confirmed that there were offers received for the company's overseas property assets, although he did not specify the value. Tatang explained that the proceeds from this divestment would be used for other, more liquid investments. In addition, there is a possibility that the divestment proceeds will be used to strengthen capital for TUGU's subsidiaries abroad.

marketNews.title: PT PP Booked New Contracts of IDR 27.09 Trillion Throughout 2024
marketNews.content: Corporate Secretary of PT PP, Joko Raharjo, said that the company recorded a new contract value of 27.09 trillion rupiah throughout 2024 (-14.5% YoY), meeting only 84.7% of the 2024 target of 32 trillion rupiah. Based on its source, 44% of the new contract value came from government projects, 29% from State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN), and 27% from the private sector. Previously, Joko mentioned that the company targeted new contract value throughout 2025 to grow +5% YoY.

marketNews.title: DPR Ratifies Amendment to the SOE Law, Establishing the BPI Danantara Investment Management Body
marketNews.content: On Tuesday (4/2), the DPR ratified the amendment to the SOE Law, which will become the legal basis for establishing the Nusantara Daya Anagata Investment Management Body (BPI Danantara) to manage state assets. The body, which will be supervised by ministers and report directly to the president, will be established with capital of approximately 1,000 trillion rupiah through cash, state assets, or government shares. This capital amount is based on the combined capital of State-Owned Enterprises in 2023, which reached 1,135 trillion rupiah. Bloomberg reported that BPI Danantara is President Prabowo's initiative to mobilize more funding for his strategic projects without inflating the State Budget (APBN). Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, did not specify which SOEs would be transferred to BPI Danantara, but national media mentioned that there were 7 SOEs to be managed by BPI Danantara at the beginning of operations. These 7 SOEs consist of Bank Mandiri ($BMRI), Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI), PT PLN, PT Pertamina, Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI), Telkom Indonesia ($TLKM), and Mining Industry Indonesia (MIND ID).

marketNews.title: ESDM Minister: Coal Exporters Mandatory to Use HBA; Permits to be Revoked if Non-Compliant
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM), Bahlil Lahadalia, said on Monday (3/2) that the government plans to mandate coal exporters to use the reference coal price (HBA) in export transactions. This idea aims to maintain the stability of Indonesian coal prices in the global market so they do not fall too low. Currently, the regulation regarding the obligation to use HBA in export transactions is still in the formulation stage and will later be stipulated in the Decree of the Minister of ESDM. Bahlil said that the Ministry of ESDM will be firm with companies that do not comply with these regulations, including the possibility of revoking export permits.

marketNews.title: Government Prepares THR Regulation for Gig Workers, Expected to be Completed in Two Weeks
marketNews.content: Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, said that the government is reviewing the regulation on the provision of 'Tunjangan Hari Raya' (THR) for workers with partner status, such as online motorcycle taxi drivers, online taxi drivers, and couriers. This regulation is estimated to be completed within the next 2 weeks.

marketNews.title: India's CPO Imports Hit 14-Year Low in January 2025, Rival Oils Gain
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that India's CPO imports in January 2025 plummeted -46% MoM to 272,000 tons, marking the lowest level since March 2011. This decline was driven by Indian refiners switching to cheaper soybean oil as a substitute for CPO. The decline in CPO imports by India, the world's largest vegetable oil importer, could weigh on the reference CPO price in Malaysia.

marketNews.title: HGBT Incentive Will Not Be Given to Export-Oriented Industries; Tariffs Set for PLN and Industrial Feedstock
marketNews.content: Minister of ESDM, Bahlil Lahadalia, said on Monday (3/2) that the certain gas price incentive (HGBT) will not be given to export-oriented industries. However, Bahlil emphasized that not all export-oriented industries will be excluded from HGBT. Bahlil also mentioned that HGBT will be imposed at 7 US dollars per MMBtu for PLN and 6.5 US dollars per MMBtu for industrial feedstock. Meanwhile, the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said that the distribution of HGBT with the new tariff will commence no later than the end of 1Q25.

marketNews.title: Prabowo Instructs ESDM Minister to Reactivate Retailers Selling 3 Kg LPG
marketNews.content: Deputy Speaker of the DPR, Sufmi Dasco Ahmad, stated on Tuesday (4/2) that President Prabowo Subianto has ordered the Minister of ESDM, Bahlil Lahadalia, to re-authorize retailers to sell 3 kg liquefied petroleum gas (LPG). This follows the Ministry of ESDM's policy prohibiting retailers from selling subsidized LPG starting February 1, 2025, which caused public protests due to the need to queue to buy from Pertamina agents. Dasco's statement came a day after Bahlil Lahadalia said on Monday (3/2) that his side was reviewing the option of making 3 kg LPG retailers official sub-depots (sub-pangkalan) of Pertamina. According to the Deputy Minister of ESDM, Yuliot Tanjung, the ban on selling 3 kg LPG through retailers was intended to ensure that the supply of subsidized LPG reaches the rightful and needy public.

marketNews.title: French Mining Company Eramet Exploring New Mining Areas in South Sulawesi and Papua
marketNews.content: Minister of Investment and Downstreaming, Rosan Roeslani, stated on Tuesday (4/2) that the French mining company, Eramet (EPA: ERMT), is currently exploring new mining areas in the South Sulawesi and Papua regions. Rosan also mentioned that Eramet plans to develop electric vehicle projects by involving various strategic partners. Eramet has not commented on this issue. Eramet's main operation in Indonesia is currently the Weda Bay Nickel Mine in Halmahera, North Maluku.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Cement Industry Targets Growth Through Exports and Domestic Projects, Projects 2025 Sales at 77 Million Tons
marketNews.content: Chairman of the Indonesian Cement Association, Lilik Unggul Raharjo, stated that the association is optimistic that domestic cement sales in 2025 will grow around +1-2% YoY, with export sales expected to remain the same as previous years' realization. Lilik mentioned that the cement industry in 2025 will still face the challenge of low utilization. Nevertheless, looking at the trend of domestic cement sales, growth opportunities are still possible this year. Lilik explained that one driver for domestic cement sales is the government's program of 3 million houses per year. The Indonesian Cement Association projects cement sales in 2025 can reach 77 million tons, with a utilization rate reaching 65%.

marketNews.title: VKTR Director Acquired VKTR Shares
marketNews.content: Director of VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas ($VKTR), Dino Ahmad Ryandi, purchased 15 million VKTR shares at an average price of 100 rupiah per share on January 30, 2025. The total transaction value reached 1.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Dino Ahmad Ryandi's ownership in VKTR increased from none previously to 0.03%.

marketNews.title: Logisticplus International Controller Acquired LOPI Shares
marketNews.content: The controller and President Director of Logisticplus International ($LOPI), Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko, purchased 304 million LOPI shares at an average price of 39 rupiah per share on January 13, 2025. The total transaction value reached 11.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko's ownership in LOPI increased from 39.3% to 67%.
